result.execSummary:
The defendant James Calvin Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court granted defendant credit for 23 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including the DNA surcharge by 08-19-16 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be entered.

- Court ordered no more municipal tickets for retail theft.
- Pay $363.00 fine from municipal case 1401112.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE, NO Huber privileges, COURT OBJECTS TO  electronic monitoring, credit for 48 days time served.
Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Calvin Wilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Calvin Wilson in court with attorney Reed J.E. Martin.  Defendant James Calvin Wilson in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Probation having been revoked, sentencing proceeded.  Statements by each counsel and defendant. 
The court sentenced defendant to serve NINE MONTHS, CONSECUTIVE,  in the House of Correction with  NO Huber privileges , COURT OBJECTS TO  electronic monitoring, credit for 48 days time served.
Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income.
Information on Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Siefert
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[    ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
( X )  Sentence After Revocation
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj

AS TO COUNT 1
Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 23 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for 1 years with the following conditions:

-Court ordered no more municipal tickets for retail theft. 
-Pay $363.00 fine from municipal case 1401112.  

-Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges; including the DNA surcharge by 8/19/2016 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be entered. 

-Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA Sample. 

Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Form and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant James Calvin Wilson in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant James Calvin Wilson in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Elements received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant James Calvin Wilson not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant James Calvin Wilson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant James Calvin Wilson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Discharge Summary.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Violation report received and filed. lr

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save - 250 W. Holt, Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant James Calvin Wilson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant James Calvin Wilson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for James Calvin Wilson
Current: 3208 North 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 06-14-2015)
Prior: 3028 North 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53207 United States
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
